content.title: Development of Strawberry Cultivation
content.details: The scheme “Development of Strawberry Cultivation” was launched by the Department of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya to provide farmers with quality and improved varieties of strawberry planting materials so as to encourage area expansion under this crop such that commercialization horticulture under this crop is achieved.
benefits: 100% assistance to the selected beneficiaries for purchasing good quality materials of strawberry runners.
100% assistance for the purchase of mulching for demonstration.
100% assistance for the purchase of drip irrigation sprayers.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Meghalaya.
The applicant should be a bonafide farmer engaged in agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 200 sqms.
content.application_process: Offline. The eligible bonafide farmer can apply/write an application on plain paper and submit it along with the required documents at the nearest office of the Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.
documents_required: Documents proof of possessing own or leased land

faqs.question: What is the key objective of the Scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide farmers with quality and improved varieties of strawberry planting materials so as to encourage area expansion under this crop such that commercialization horticulture under this crop is achieved.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Department Of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare, Government of Meghalaya.

faqs.question: What is the pattern of assistance?
faqs.answer: Assistance to the selected Govt. run farm and also a scale of 50% subsidies to the strawberry spokes.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers engaged in Agriculture, possessing own or leased land of at least 200sqms are eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers can apply in plain paper through the nearest Horticulture Development Officer of a CD Block/ Horticulture Circle.

faqs.question: What is the beneficiaries’ selection procedure?
faqs.answer: The bonafide farmers shall be selected on a first come first serve basis.
